title: Firefox 45.0beta Beta

notes.note: Instant browser tab sharing through Hello

[Tabs synced][1] via Firefox Accounts from other devices are now shown in dropdown area of Awesome Bar when searching


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/awesome-bar-search-firefox-bookmarks-history-tabs#w_how-to-use-the-autocomplete-list
GTK3 integration (GNU/Linux only). Disabled after beta 4
Introduce a new preference (*network.dns.blockDotOnion*) to allow blocking .onion at the DNS level

[Push API][1] support, part of [Progressive Web Applications][2]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Push_API
  [2]: https://blog.mozilla.org/futurereleases/2015/11/17/extending-the-webs-capabilities-in-firefox-and-beyond/
Support delivery of a Content Security Policy (CSP) via a meta tag

[List of animated properties and keyframes][1] is now displayed when clicking on an animation in the animation-inspector’s timeline


  [1]: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Un3u4wuGT8Q
Inspector search now matches results from all content in the page, including subframes

Support for [diffing heap snapshots][1] added to the memory tool


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Memory#Diffing_heap_snapshots

Added [Negative url filtering][1] for the network monitor


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor#Filtering_by_URL

DOMContentLoaded and load events shown in the [network monitor timeline][1]


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Network_Monitor#Timeline
Fine tune animations by changing the playback rate of animations in the animation-inspector's timeline

Ability to [filter snapshot output][1] in memory tool


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Tools/Memory#Analyzing_a_snapshot
URLs containing a Unicode-format Internationalized Domain Name (IDN) are now properly redirected

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that 64-bit builds of Firefox are only supported on Windows 7 and higher.*

### Recommended Hardware
-  Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
-  512MB of RAM
-  200MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8
- Mac OS X 10.9
- Mac OS X 10.10
- Mac OS X 10.11

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - GTK+ 3.4 or higher
    - GLib 2.22 or higher
    - Pango 1.14 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
    - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
    - GNOME 2.16 or higher
